tools: Any {@filter tool or artisan's tool|items|source=xphb|type=tool;artisan's tools} of your choice

default: (a) a {@item light crossbow|xphb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|xphb|20 bolts} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=xphb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item priest's pack|xphb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|xphb}
a {@filter tool or artisan's tool|items|source=xphb|type=tool;artisan's tools} of your choice
{@item leather armor|xphb}, and an {@item arcane focus|XPHB}

entries: Secretive by nature, thaumaturges are those that practice magic in the quiet, away from prying eyes. Drawing on the powers of the mind to share secrets and learn from those they trust, thaumaturges combine their sharp intellect with veneration of beings of a higher power, both divine and otherwise. Their magic is largely primal, but the learned nature of their specialized covens allows them to expand their bailiwick to other spheres of magical influence. With a mind of study, and the ability to channel divine power, the thaumaturge is no ordinary spellcaster.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Your connection to either your deity or nature (or both) through prayer has afforded you magical abilities.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know four cantrips of your choice from the {@filter thaumaturge spell list|spells|level=0|class=Thaumaturge (Andreya)}. You learn an additional thaumaturge cantrip of your choice at 4th level and another at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Thaumaturge Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You know a number of spells from the {@filter thaumaturge spell list|spells|class=Thaumaturge (Andreya)} according to your Thaumaturge level. To start, choose two level 1 Thaumaturge spells.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Thaumaturge levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Thaumaturge Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Thaumaturge spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Sorcerer Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Thaumaturge, your list of prepared spells can include six Thaumaturge spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Thaumaturge feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Thaumaturge spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace one spell on your list with another Thaumaturge spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Thaumaturge spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB} or a {@item Yew Wand|XPHB|Wooden Wand} as a {@variantrule spellcasting focus|XPHB} for your Thaumaturge spells.

classFeature.name: Whispered Secrets
entries: You create a stagnant invisible bubble around you and all creatures within 15ft, wether they be friend or foe. Any creature outside of that bubble cannot hear words spoken within the bubble, and it will appear as if you are whispering to each other in a language that creature does not understand. The bubble is visible with {@sense truesight|xphb}, or with the benefit of spells such as {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB}. A character can make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check with DC equal to your spell save DC + 5 to see through the illusion. This can be dispelled by the {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} (for the purposes of {@spell Dispel Magic|xphb}, the bubble is equivalent to a 5th level spell). The bubble lasts up to 10 minutes.
You can do this once per short rest. At level 10, you gain the ability to choose to increase the size of the bubble to 30ft, and it moves with you.

classFeature.name: Dire Sacrifice
entries: When you cast a spell, you may impose {@variantrule disadvantage|xphb} on the saving throw for one creature. Roll a number of d8 dice equal to the spell level, and suffer half of the total (rounded up) as necrotic damage. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
You may impose {@variantrule disadvantage|xphb} on the saving throw for additional creatures on the same spell by using this ability an additonal time per additional target.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You can channel divine energy directly from the Outer Planes (or from the Inner Planes, depending on the source of your power), using it to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Group Salvation and Secret Nature, which are described below. Other Thaumaturge features give additional Channel Divinity effect options. Each time you use this class's Channel Divinity, you choose which effect from this class to create.

You can use this class's Channel Divinity once. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule short rest|xphb}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule long rest|xphb}. You gain additional uses when you reach certain Thaumaturge levels, as shown in the Channel Divinity column of the Thaumaturge Features table.
If a Channel Divinity effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals the spell save DC from this class's Spellcasting feature.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Group Salvation
entries: You can heal your allies. As a {@action magic|XPHB} action, roll any number of your hit dice. You can divide the total however you like amongst creatures you choose within 30ft. These hit dice are expended.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Secret Nature
entries: As a {@action magic|XPHB} action, you create 15ft radius hemisphere of invisibility centred on yourself, making any creatures that you choose and any object worn or carried by these creatures benefit from the {@condition invisible|xphb} condition. This dome is stationary and lasts up to one hour, taking your {@status concentration|XPHB} as if you were concentrating on a spell.

A creature within the sphere loses the benefit of your invisibility after making an attack roll or casting a spell that does damage or in any way adversely affects a creature {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|xphb|hostile} to them. Once lost, a creature cannot benefit from this invisibility again until you use another Channel Divinity.

classFeature.name: Learned Individual
entries: Learning {@variantrule Downtime Activity: Training|xge|learning languages or tool proficiencies} from an ally takes you half the amount of weeks (halved {@i after} applying any reduction from your intelligence modifier, and rounded up). For example, if you have an Intellegence modifier of +3, instead of taking you 7 weeks to complete training in this way, it would only take you 4 (3.5 rounded up).

In addition, once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}, as a reaction to seeing a non-damaging spell be cast, you may gain the ability to cast that spell as a thaumaturge spell. You must use spell slots of the appropriate level to cast this spell. The ability to cast this spell fades on your next {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

classFeature.name: Thaumaturge Coven
entries: You gain a Thaumaturge subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Thaumaturge levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Thaumaturge level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Complex Mind
entries: If you fail a Charisma, Wisdom or Intelligence saving throw, you may choose to reroll the save, and keep the higher roll. You may use this feature a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Thaumaturge subclass.

classFeature.name: Shadow Walk
entries: When in {@variantrule darkness|XPHB}, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on any sound-based Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks
You do not need to fulfil the verbal components of any thaumaturge spells.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Secret Network
entries: You bind yourself mentally with those you have come to trust. As an action, choose a number of creatures (which can include yourself) up to 2 × your intelligence modifier. For the next hour, the chosen creatures are able to reroll an ability check or saving throw. This reroll is communal and is expended for everyone after a creature uses it.

This feature can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}. You may only have one use of this ability active at a time, but creatures may benefit from multiple uses of this feature simultaneously from other Thaumaturges.

classFeature.name: Improved Whispered Secrets
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Whispered Secrets|Thaumaturge|Andreya|1} feature, you may choose to extend the radius of the bubble to 30ft. Additionally, when you move while using this feature, the bubble moves with you.

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature from your Thaumaturge subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Branching Paths
entries: Choose another coven from the Thaumaturge subclasses. You gain the 3rd level feature from that coven. You do not gain the additional spells or channel divinity option from that coven.

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Thaumaturge subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature from your Thaumaturge subclass.

classFeature.name: Attentive
entries: You now have 120ft of {@variantrule telepathy|xphb} and no longer need to fulfil the verbal components of any spell, regardless of if it is a thaumaturge spell for you.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Convergent Paths
entries: The second coven you chose as part of your {@classFeature Branching Paths|Thaumaturge|Andreya|13} feature becomes empowered. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain one spell per level from your chosen coven's extended spell list. You may cast each of these spells once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb} without expending a spell slot. You can also cast these spells using spell slots of an appropraite level.
You gain your chosen coven's Channel Divinity option from level 3.
Whenever you roll initiative, you can recover a use of your {@classFeature Complex Mind|Thaumaturge|Andreya|5} feature.

entries: For example, if you took {@subclass Soulkeeper|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Andreya} as your branching path, you gain {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity: Ghastly Visage|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Soulkeeper|Andreya|3} as a Channel Divinity option, and you could choose {@spell Cause Fear|XGE}, {@spell Wither and Bloom|SCC}, {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB}, {@spell Blight|XPHB} and {@spell Enervation|XGE} as your additional spells.

subclass.name: Path of the High Wind
subclassFeatures: Path of the High Wind|Barbarian|XPHB|High Wind|Andreya|3

subclass.name: Order of the Cryptid
subclassFeatures: Blood Curse of the Transmuter|Blood Hunter|BH2022|Cryptid|Andreya|18

subclassFeature.name: Keeper of the Tomb
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the table below. Each of these spells counts as a thaumaturge spell for you and is always prepared, but it doesn't count against the number of thaumaturge spells you know.
When you gain a level in this class, you may swap any of these spells for {@filter divination or necromancy spells|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|school=D;N} of the same level.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Rejuvenation
entries: When a creature dies within 60ft of you, you can use your reaction to regain a spell slot of a level up to half of your proficiency bonus (rounded down). You can use feature this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Ghastly Visage
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to exude a terrifying presence, as haunting (but harmless) spirits coalesce around you.

As a {@action magic|XPHB} action, you force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened|XPHB} of you for 1 minute. A creature frightened in this way can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Voice of the Spirits
entries: When in places of great tragedy, or anywhere else that serves as the final resting place of many people, you can see friendly spirits nearby. These spirits retain their original personality. They will answer 3 questions honestly, but may be unable to answer, or choose not to answer at all.
After using this ability to talk to a spirit, they fade away and leave you unable to see them.

subclassFeature.name: Gift of the Beyond
entries: You gain resistance to necrotic damage, and {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on saving throws caused by undead. Additionally, when you use your {@subclassFeature Grim Rejuvenation|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Soulkeeper|Andreya|3} feature, you can grant an ally within 30ft {@variantrule advantage} on their next d20 test.

subclassFeature.name: Unflappable
entries: You learn to listen for the whispers of spirits. You become immune to the {@condition frightened|XPHB} condition, and gain {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill History|XPHB) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Successor
entries: If a creature you hit with a damaging spell has already taken damage, they take an additional die (whichever die the spell uses for damage — if it uses multiple kinds of dice, you ay choose) of necrotic damage, and gain {@variantrule temporary hit points|XPHB} equal to the extra damage rolled. This extra die is only rolled once per spell.

subclassFeature.name: Extraplanar Liaison
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the table below. Each of these spells counts as a thaumaturge spell for you and is always prepared, but it doesn't count against the number of thaumaturge spells you know.
When you gain a level in this class, you may swap any of these spells for {@filter divination or conjuration spells|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|school=D;C} of the same level.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Sigils
entries: You spend one minute conjuring an effect granted by your understanding of planar magic. You may spend an additional use to use this sigil instantaneously.
Choose one of the options from the list below:

items.name: Sigil of the Upper Planes
items.entry: You conjure an angelic presence. You and any creatures you choose within 30ft gain {@variantrule temporary hit points|xphb} equal to your thaumaturge level + your Intelligence modifier.

items.name: Sigil of the Neutral Planes
entries: You conjure a portal in front of you. You, and any creatures you choose up to a maximum equal to twice your Intelligence modifier can teleport up to 100ft away, bringing any worn or carried objects with you. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45- degree angle, 300 feet."

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creatures traveling with you each take {@damage 4d6} force damage, and you fail to teleport, expending a use of this feature.
You may expend a number of additional uses of this feature to increase the range by 100ft per additional use.

items.name: Sigil of the Lower Planes
entries: You conjure a servant of shadows for a number of minutes equal to your intelligence score.

The servant benefits from the amorphous property and is {@condition invisiblity|xphb|invisible}. It can be percieved with {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}. The servant cannot interact with objects, but they can move through gaps of any size.
You can use your bonus action to look through their eyes as they move through the shadows, following your orders. While looking through their eyes, you can read and understand all languages.

You are {@variantrule telepathy|xphb|telepathically} linked to this servant while it is within 1 mile of you. While telepathically linked, you can issue commands to the servant. If the servant leaves this range, the link severs.
You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Sigilic Defenses
entries: As a {@action magic|XPHB} action, you conjure a wall of stone 3ft high, 30ft long and 1ft thick, in a continuous arrangement of your choosing. This wall provides {@variantrule half cover|xphb}, and each 1ft length of wall has an AC of 10 and 10 {@variantrule hit points|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Order and Chaos
entries: When one or more creatures are affected by any spell you cast that inflicts damage, you may imbue that spell with the power of the planes of Order or Chaos. This change affects all creatures affected by the spell. Choose one of either options:

items.name: Order
entries: Instead of rolling damage, each damage die deals its average result + 1.

For example, if you cast {@spell Flaming Sphere}, instead of rolling 2d6, the spell would deal 10 damage - the average roll of a d6 is rounded up to 4, adding 1 to make 5, then multiplied by 2 for a total of 10.

items.name: Chaos
entries: Roll a d4 to determine an additional effect of the spell:

rows: After the spell is resolved, you teleport in a random direction to an unoccupied space within 60ft. The DM decides what dice to roll, and which direction the result of the roll equates to.
The damage type of the spell changes to psychic damage. If it was already psychic damage, nothing changes.

Until the start of your next turn, saving throws made against the spell are made at {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB}, and any attack rolls made as part of the spell have {@variantrule advantage|XPHB}.
If the effects of the spell persist over multiple turns (such as {@spell Moonbeam|XPHB}), you may choose expend one additional use of this ability per turn.

Roll an additional number of damage dice equal to half of your proficiency bonus. If the spell uses multiple types of dice for damage (such as {@spell Chaos Bolt|XGE}), you may choose which dice to roll, and deal the corresponding damage type.

entries: You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Sigil Master
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Planar Sigils|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Planeseeker|Andreya|3} feature, you may impart an additional effect according to the option you choose.

items.name: Sigil of the Upper Planes
items.entry: You gain a fly speed equal to your walking speed for the next hour.

items.name: Sigil of the Neutral Planes
entries: You and the creatures that teleported with share a communal ward against death. The first time one of you hits zero hit points, that creature will instead fall to one hit point. This lasts for 8 hours from the time of teleporting and functions like the {@spell Death Ward|xphb} spell.

items.name: Sigil of the Lower Planes
entries: Your servant can now interact with objects, and has a carrying capacity of 50lbs.

Additionally, after using this ability you gain resistance to a damage type of your choosing until your next {@variantrule long rest|xphb}. You cannot have more than resistance at a time from this ability, but you may swap the damage type if you use this ability again before your next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Conjuration Master
entries: Once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}, you may pick any {@filter conjuration spell|spells|school=C} of a level that you can cast. This spell can now be cast by you as a thaumaturge spell, and does not count against the number of thaumaturge spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Mysterious Clairvoyant
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the table below. Each of these spells counts as a thaumaturge spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of thaumaturge spells you know.
When you gain a level in this class, you may swap any of these spells for {@filter divination or abjuration spells|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|school=D;A} of the same level.

entries.caption: Extended Spell List
rows: {@spell dispel evil and good|xphb}, {@spell greater restoration|xphb}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Prevent Outcome
entries: You can channel your power to manipulate fate in key moments to your advantage.
When you see a creature within 60ft of you miss an attack roll or fail a saving throw, you may use your reaction to instead turn the attack roll into a hit, or saving throw into a success.

Alternatively, if you see a creature within 60ft of you suffer a {@variantrule critical hit|XPHB}, you may use your reaction to instead turn it into a normal hit, preventing any additional benefits that would have been triggered by the critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Premonition
entries: At the start of each day, you recieve a number of premonitions equal to your proficiency bonus. Roll a {@dice d6} for each premonition. You can use your {@action reaction} to expend one of these premonitions, adding or subtracting the number from a creature's d20 test within 30ft.
On your next {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}, you lose any unspent premonitions, and roll new ones.
At 10th level, you roll a {@dice d10} for each premonition instead of a d6.

subclassFeature.name: Glimpse of Misfortune
entries: As a bonus action, you can share glimpses into the possibilities that will befall you and your companions. You can grant an ally {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on their next saving throw, or impose {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls to hit them until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) per {@variantrule short rest|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Protector of Fate
entries: When you cast any abjuration or divination spell (regardless of if it is a thaumaturge spell), you may choose to grant the target of the spell {@variantrule temporary hit points|xphb} equal to the level of the spell plus your thaumaturge level. If the spell has multiple targets, each target gets half of this number as temporary hit points.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Premonition
entries: You now roll a {@dice d10} instead of a d6 per {@subclassFeature Premonition|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Oracle|Andreya|3|premonition} each day.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Insight
entries: When you roll initiative, you learn up to 3 properties total across any creatures you see within 120ft. You can choose to learn one property of three different creatures, choose to learn 3 properties of one creature, or anything in between. You can choose the same property on different creatures.
Choose which properties you learn from the following list:

items: Constitution score
Intelligence score
Wisdom score
Armor class
Current hit point total
Total class levels, if any
Condition immunities
Damage resistances and immunities
Damage vulnerabilities
Highest level of spell that the creature can cast

subclassFeature.name: Indiscernible by Sight
entries: You learn the {@spell Minor Illusion} cantrip, or another thaumaturge cantrip if you already have it. This does not count against the number of cantrips known in the Thaumaturge Feature table.

Additionally, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the table below. Each of these spells counts as a thaumaturge spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of thaumaturge spells you know.
When you gain a level in this class, you may swap any of these spells for {@filter divination or illusion spells|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|school=D;I} of the same level.

subclassFeature.name: Wishful Fantasy
entries: By expending a use of this feature, you gain insight into a creature's desires as a free action.

If what they seek is a feeling or idea, you will learn what it is, but won't recieve context. For example, For example, you may be able to tell a creature is feeling anguish and loss and seeking comfort, but this wont tell you that their mother has died.
If what they seek is material, you will recieve a rough visualization (including size and shape) of the object, but not what it is or does, unless the you are familiar with the object.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}. Spells and other effects that cloud a creature's thoughts (such as {@spell Mind Blank|XPHB}) shield a creature from this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Thought Oasis
entries: As a {@action bonus action|XPHB}, you create a visual illusion that fits into a 30ft cube. This 30ft cube is static, but the illusions within the space can move. If the illusions appear harmful, creatures within the cube that you choose must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, roll a number of {@dice d8}s equal to your proficiency bonus. They take psychic damage equal to the roll's result.

Affected creatures may make Wisdom saving throws at the end of each of their turns. While the illusion remains, or until they succeed, the creature will perceive these illusions as an immediate threat and may go so far as to flee from or attack the illusions.
Another creature may use their action to shake an affected creature to their senses to end this effect early. This illusion lasts up to one minute.

subclassFeature.name: Warden of Thought
entries: As an action, you may enter a the mind of a humanoid you're familiar with. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw, adding a bonus of +5 to their result if they are awake, or a penalty of -5 if they're asleep. Once you are in their mind, you can do one of the following:

items: You seek out a memory regarding a particular topic of your choosing.
You see through their eyes (if they're awake) or view their dreams from their point of view (if they're asleep) for 1 minute.
You instill a powerful feeling or emotion within someone, such as fear, joy, sadness. Attraction cannot be created in this way.

entries: Once you complete any of these options, you return to your own body. You can use this feature once per {@variantrule short rest|xphb}, but cannot use it on the same target more than once per {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}
Furthermore, in addition to swapping one of your spells on a {@variantrule long rest}, you may switch out a second spell, but the spell you swap with must be an illusion spell on your spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Hopeful Mirage
entries: By expending 2 uses of your {@subclassFeature Wishful Fantasy|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Dreamweaver|Andreya|3} feature, you may use your action to conjure an illusion that requires an active DC20 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check to see through. This illusion looks and feels real, and lasts for up to one hour.

If you have used {@subclassFeature Wishful Fantasy|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Dreamweaver|Andreya|3} on a creature within the last hour, you can use the information obtained to conjure something close to what their desires represent, and impose {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on any skill checks they make to see through the illusion.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Dreams
entries: You can passively using illusions to disguise the movements of your mouth. You can now cast any illusion spells without completing the verbal component.

Additionally, you are now able to create a mass dream and enrapture a large group. As an action, all creatures that you choose to affect within a 150ft sphere (centred on yourself) must make an Intelligence save equal to your spell save DC, or be left in a dreamy stupor, seeing a blissful or nostalgic image. Any creatures who fail the save are {@condition incapacitated|XPHB} for up to 10 minutes. You must {@status concentration|xphb|concentrate} on this effect. If you lose concentration, or an affected creature is damaged or shaken awake with an action, they snap out of this state and are no longer incapacitated. You can create a mass dream in this way once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Blessings of the Laboratory
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to break things (and creatures) down to their basic components. When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to destroy a non-magical item, weapon or piece of armor held or worn by the creature. If the creature is an elemental, plant or construct, they also take force damage equal to 2 × your thaumaturge level.

subclassFeature.name: Transmutative Curiosity
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the table below. Each of these spells counts as a thaumaturge spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of thaumaturge spells you know.
When you gain a level in this class, you may swap any of these spells for {@filter divination or transmutation spells|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|school=D;T} of the same level.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Cocktail
entries: At the end of a {@variantrule long rest|xphb}, you can infuse a vial of water on your person with the effects of a spell with a casting time of one action or one bonus action. You must use two spell slots of appropriate level for a spell to be able to make infused with that spell.
When you make a salve, the type of salve it is depends on the effects of the spell. There are 3 types of salves: Enriching, Destructive and Tempestuous.

items.name: Enriching
entries: A spell infused into a salve is Enriching if the spell restores HP, or buffs an ally. Buffing an ally is defined by any spell effect that increases an attribute on their character sheet, such as creature size, movement speed, {@variantrule armor class|xphb}, any bonus to a d20 test, or having {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on a d20 test.

items.name: Destructive
entries: A spell infused into a salve is Destructive if its effects involve rolling damage dice

items.name: Tempestuous
entries: A spell infused into a salve is Tempestuous if it fits {@i both} or {@i neither} of the other two categories, or is otherwise ambiguous depending on the context of the spell.

For example, {@spell Wither and Bloom|SCC} makes a Tempestuous salve because it fits both the Enriching and Destructive definition. {@spell Slow|XPHB} also makes a Tempestuous salve, because it fits neither. {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} also makes a Tempestuous salve, since it can be used to buff, hinder, or both.

Once crafted, this salve can be drunk by yourself as a {@action bonus action}, fed to an ally as an action, or thrown at a target using the {@action Attack action|XPHB}. Salves are considered as a thrown weapon that you are proficient in, and you may use your Intelligence modifier for the ranged attack roll.

If a salve thrown in this way is infused with a spell would normally require a spell attack roll immediately upon casting, then the ranged attack roll to throw the salve is used for the spell attack roll. If this attack misses, then the salve and spell effect within are wasted.

Salves that are infused with spells that require {@status concentration|xphb} still require concentration to maintain their effects when the salve is used. If the salve was consumed, whoever drank it must maintain concentration. If it was thrown, whoever threw it must maintain concentration.

entries.name: Counterspell and Dispel Magic
entries: Salves can be interacted with in the same way as other spells by spells such as {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} and {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}. If you're competent enough to cast Counterspell, you can work out how to cast {@i 'Counterspill'}
A salve lasts a number of {@variantrule long rest|xphb|long rests} equal to your Intelligence modifier before they become inert vials of water.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Spice
entries: When using your {@subclassFeature Spell Cocktail|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Salvemaker|Andreya|3} feature, you can choose to throw in a little extra.

When you create the salve, roll a {@dice d6} to determine the additional effect from either the Enriching, Destructive or Tempestuous effect tables, depending on the spell. This increases to a d8 at level 10 and then a d10 at level 14, with additional effects becoming possible at these levels.

The extra effect is considered part of the infused spell. If the extra effect requires {@status concentration|XPHB}, then the infused spell now requires concentration for its duration, and losing concentration causes all effects to fade.
If the additional affect applies to a single target of the spell, but the spell affects multiple targets, choose one of the spell's targets to be impacted by the additional effect.

entries.caption: Enriching
rows: One effect of the spell (your choice) is halved (e.g the amount of dice rolled for recovered hit points is halved). If no effects can be halved, then the duration of the spell is halved.
The target also benefits from the effects of the {@spell Bless|XPHB} spell for one minute, requiring your {@status concentration|xphb}.
You cast {@spell Healing Spirit|XGE} without concentration. This lasts for one hour.
The target gains {@variantrule resistance|xphb} to fire, cold or lightning damage (your choice) for one hour.
The target additionally gains the effects of {@spell Death Ward|XPHB} for 8 hours.

The spell is upcast at one level higher than the slots used to create the salve. If the spell's effects do not scale when cast at a higher level, the target's walking speed is instead increased by 10ft.
The target becomes {@variantrule resistance|xphb|resistant} to all damage for one round. If the spell targets multiple creatures, choose one affected creature to gain this benefit.

The target gains the benefits of the {@spell Haste|XPHB} spell (requiring your {@status concentration|XPHB}) for a number of rounds equal to the Intelligence modifier of the thaumaturge who created the salve (minimum of one). Once concentration is lost, or the number of rounds passes, the creature is {@condition incapacitated|XPHB} and has a speed of 0 for one round.
Creatures of your choice within 30ft gain a number of {@variantrule temporary hit points|xphb} equal to your level.
The target has {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on all d20 tests for one hour.

entries.caption: Destructive
rows: The number of dice rolled for damage is halved.
You cast {@spell Sleep|XPHB}, centred on the target, after the original spell has been cast.
The target teleports a number of feet into the air equal to a roll of a {@dice d100}. They immediately plummet. If they are indoors, the height rolled is capped at the height of the ceiling.
The target bursts into flames. When they are first affected by the salve, and at the end of all of their turns, they take a {@damage d6} of fire damage. The flames can be extinguished with an action.

Another creature of your choice within 30ft of the target gets splashed by the salve. They may make a Dexterity save against your spell save DC, suffering half the damage of the original effect on a failure. If the spell affected multiple targets, the single target you choose for this effect must be within 30ft of anyone affected by the spell, but can be someone who was affected by the original spell effect.

TRoll 2 additional damage dice specified by the spell (if the spell uses multiple kinds of dice/does different types of damage simultaneously, you may choose the additional dice/damage type) and add it to the total damage.
The salve puts the target under the effects of {@spell Elemental Bane|XGE}, requiring your {@status concentration|xphb}. You choose the damage type, as per the Elemental Bane's description.
The salve also contains the effects of {@spell Phantasmal Killer|XPHB}, requiring your concentration.
The target has {@variantrule disadvantage} on the saving throw required by the spell.
Roll double the amount of dice rolled for the infused spell's damage.

entries.caption: Tempestuous
rows: You become {@variantrule resistance|xphb|resistant} to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison and thunder damage, but become {@variantrule vulnerability|xphb|vulnerable} to magical bludgeoning, peircing and slashing damage, for 1 minute.
You cast {@spell Sending|XPHB}, to a target chosen by the DM
Your carrying capacity doubles for the next hour.

The size category of your torso increases by one category. Attacks with weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on a hit. Your lower body decreases by one size category, halving your movement speed. This lasts for one minute.
The next non-magical object of no more than 5 cubic feet of volume that you touch turns to solid gold. The DM may decide if this interferes with the object's original function.
All of your hair changes to the colour of your eyes until your next {@variantrule long rest}.
You recover a number of spell slots. The combined level of the recovered spell slots cannot exceed half of your thaumaturge level (rounded down).

Your outfit becomes that of a local noble that is viewed favorably. You have {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on all Charisma checks, but {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks for the next hour.

You gain the benefits of the {@spell Shapechange|XPHB} spell, requiring your concentration. This lasts for up to number of rounds equal to the Intelligence modifier of the thaumaturge that created the salve (minimum of one).

subclassFeature.name: Salve Adept
entries: When you roll any ability check to identify a tincture, potion or other liquid substance, you may add twice your proficiency to the roll.

Additionally, when you use your {@subclassFeature Extra Spice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Salvemaker|Andreya|6} feature, you now roll twice on the relevant table and pick which roll to use. If you roll the same effect twice, you are stuck with that effect.

Finally, your salves are now stable enough to be safely handled by people other than you. You can throw your salves to allies within 30ft, with no roll required. Passing them a salve in this way is considered interacting with an object. They can also throw a salve passed in this way by making a ranged spell attack using their Intelligence modifier. Any effects from the {@subclassFeature Extra Spice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Salvemaker|Andreya|6} that affect 'you' affect the ally who used the salve.

subclassFeature.name: Collaborative Chemistry
entries: Your allies are now able to assist you when you make your salves. You can now imbue your salves with your allies' spells, if they use 2 spell slots of appropriate level needed to create the salve.
In addition, if you miss on an attack roll with your salve, it magically teleports back into your hand, allowing you to try again on subsequent actions.

subclassFeature.name: Master Alchemist
entries: You can now make 2 salves per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.
Once per day, when you use your {@subclassFeature Extra Spice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Salvemaker|Andreya|6} feature, you may choose one of the effects instead of rolling for them.

subclassFeature.name: Fundamental Arcana
entries: You learn to read, write and speak {@language primordial|xphb}, and gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature|xphb} skill

Additionally, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the table below. Each of these spells counts as a thaumaturge spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of thaumaturge spells you know.
When you gain a level in this class, you may swap any of these spells for {@filter evocation spells|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|school=V} of the same level.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Primordial Being
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to channel your understanding of the four elements and give them shape. As a {@action magic|XPHB} action, you can summon either an {@creature earth elemental|xmm|earth}, {@creature fire elemental|xmm|fire}, {@creature water elemental|xmm|water} or {@creature air elemental|xmm}. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 5ft of you, and has {@variantrule hit points|xphb} equal to 5 + 5 × your thaumaturge level, and otherwise has all the traits specified in the chosen statblock.

The creature is under your control and acts immediately after you do. While they are present, your damaging spells are more potent. You can add your Intelligence modifier to any damage dealt by a spell you cast until the creature is reduced to 0 hit points or is dismissed.
The elemental disappears after 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Enthusiast
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you may change the damage type to cold, fire, lightning or thunder. You may do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per {@variantrule short rest|xphb}.
Additionally, you may use your {@classFeature Learned Individual|Thaumaturge|Andreya|3} feature on spells that deal fire, cold, lightning or thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tempest Arcane
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Elemental Enthusiast|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Elemental Scion|Andreya|3} feature, you gain additional benefits. The spell has an additional effect from the table below, depending on which damage type you choose:

rows: The target takes an additional damage die of cold damage (if the spell uses multiple kinds of dice for damage, choose one) and must make a Constitution save against your spell save DC. On a failed save, their speed, is reduced to zero until the start of your next turn. On a success their movement speed is reduced by 15ft until the start of your next turn.

The targets of your spell burst into flames. While they are on fire, they suffer an additional 1d6 damage at the start of each of their turns. The flames can be put out with an action, or any spell or ability that would suppress the fire.

Choose one creature affected by the spell. They must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, they have {@variantrule disadvantage|xphb} on their d20 tests until the start of your next turn.

Creatures affected by the spell must make a Strength saving against your spell save DC. On a failure, they are be pushed back 15ft. If they do not have 15ft to travel, they are instead pushed as far as they can go and are knocked {@condition prone|xphb}. On a successful save, they are knocked back 5ft and do not go prone.

subclassFeature.name: Combined Elements
entries: When you are targetted with an attack roll or are the sole target of a spell, you can use your reaction to call upon a para-elemental force to protect you.

rows: You drag your attacker down with you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, or become {@condition restrained|XPHB} by the frigid winds encircling them until the start of your next turn.
A geyser of magma appears beneath the feet of your foe. They must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, or suffer {@damage 4d10} fire damage.
You create a 20ft sphere of difficult terrain, centred on a point you can see within 60ft of you.
You surround yourself in a haze of smoke. All attack rolls made against you are made at {@variantrule disadvantage|xphb} until the start of your next turn.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Investiture of Quintessence
entries: You always have the spells {@spell Investiture of Flame|XGE}, {@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE}, {@spell Investiture of Stone|XGE} and {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE} prepared.
Once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}, you may cast one of these spells without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Aether Master
entries: Once per long rest, when you use your {@subclassFeature Tempest Arcane|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Elemental Scion|Andreya|6} feature or your {@subclassFeature Combined Elements|Thaumaturge|Andreya|Elemental Scion|Andreya|6}, you may choose an additonal effect from their respective tables, subject to the original requirements of each. You cannot choose the same effect twice.
After you have used this feature, you may use it again before you next complete a long rest by expending two uses of the feature at a time.

Additionally, when you cast {@spell Investiture of Flame|XGE}, {@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE}, {@spell Investiture of Stone|XGE} or {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE}, you do not need to concentrate on the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the High Wind
entries: Some barbarians seek to use the sky as an arena to meet their ends. Those who walk the Path of the High Wind harness energy from the elemental plane of air to fuel the primal bloodlust born from rage. Derived from the ancient teachings of the Dragoon warriors, these barbarians are capable of unrivalled acrobatic ability, leaping into the sky with furious intent - that intent indeed being of a violent nature.

subclassFeature.name: Leap of Anger
entries: You gain access to the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} cantrip.

While raging, you may expend one use of this feature to leap 10 feet into the air as part of one of your attacks. This will grant you advantage to hit with your melee weapon attack and you can add {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage to your attack, however, you will also take the same d6 of damage. You may only use this feature once per round of combat.

This increases to {@damage 2d6} and 20ft at 9th level and {@damage 3d6} and 30ft at 17th level in the barbarian class. This type of attack does not provoke attacks of opportunity as it is part of the same attack, and the attacker will land within melee range of their foe.
This feature is useable a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Whirling Thrust
entries: Beginning at 6th level, the elemental energy from the plane of air can provide supernatural propulsion to you in a moment of need.

If a flying creature or object is within your movement range at the start of your turn, you may expend 2 uses of your {@subclassFeature Leap of Anger|Barbarian|XPHB|High Wind|Andreya|3} feature to hit them.
Additionally, you gain the {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Nimble Landing
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to land gently after sufficient practice and perfection of your Primal Path's abilitites.
While raging you are immune to damage from falling up to 50 ft, including the damage taken from {@subclassFeature Leap of Anger|Barbarian|XPHB|High Wind|Andreya|3}.

Additionally, you gain advantage on {@skill Acrobatics} checks, and can use your {@subclassFeature Whirling Thrust|Barbarian|XPHB|High Wind|Andreya|6} feature to aid in climbing or leaping to a point of interest.

subclassFeature.name: Sky Shatter
entries: At 14th level, your extraplanar connection continues to flourish. As an attack, you may leap into the air using the same rules as {@subclassFeature Leap of Anger|Barbarian|XPHB|High Wind|Andreya|3}. When doing so, you conjure four javelins of pure energy, created from the unbridled chaos of the Plane of Air. Roll to hit with each javelin, with advantage. Each javelin does {@damage 2d6} force damage plus your strength modifier.
You may use this feature once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Scalebearers
entries: The Oath of the Scalebearers calls to the nomadic warriors of Titan, protectors of their homeland and defenders of great creatures of myth who are in need of protection.  Harnessing the very power of those being their sworn to watch over, paladins who swear this oath stand against those who would try to hunt these creatures for sport, or means more nefarious.

Such guardians believe in the beauty of the creatures of the world, often making offerings and prayers to entities or deities such as Bahamut and Helm who influence Justice and Protection. At the same time, they answer the call to hunt those unnatural creatures that too often seek to wretch control over the natural order with ill intent, bringing terror to the cycle of life as we know it.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Scalebearers Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of the Scalebearers Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of the Scalebearers Spells
rows: {@spell Wall of Fire|XPHB}, {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Weapon
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to enchant one weapon that you wield with a type of elemental damage. For 10 minutes, you may add {@damage 1d8} of this damage to all melee attacks made with this weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Chromatic Fervor
entries: After you deal damage to a creature with your Divine Smite feature, you can use your Channel Divinity as a bonus action and gain one elemental resistance of your choice. This resistance persists until the end of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Sight
entries: You emanate an aura that grants you and your companions dragon-like vision, allowing you to see even the most hidden things. You gain 10ft of {@sense Truesight}. In addition, if you aren't {@condition incapacitated|xphb}, any ally who starts their turn within 10 feet of you gains this benefit as well.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Scales
entries: When you make a saving throw against a spell or effect that deals elemental damage, you can use your reaction to absorb some of the damage dealt. On a failed save, the damage dealt to you is zero and on a success, you gain {@variantrule temporary hit points|XPHB} equal to half the damage total, to a maximum of 50 temporary hit points.
This feature can be used once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Sight (18th Level)
entries: When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of your {@subclassFeature Aura of Sight|Paladin|XPHB|Scalebearers|Andreya|3} increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Dragon
entries: You can empower yourself with the power of those you are sworn to defend. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: If your Armor Class was less than 22, it is raised to 22.
You gain resistance to all elemental damage.
You can make Strength and Constitution saving throws at advantage against effects and spells you can see.

entries: This effect ends early if you become {@condition incapacitated|xphb}, or die. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Cryptid
entries: The Order of the Cryptid is the most secret of the blood hunter orders, its members dedicating their lives to finding terrifying monsters of myth and dispatching them. Cryptid hunters seek out and study obscure knowledge of these beings, and obsessively attempt to harness it, taking on attributes of the very beings they seek to destroy. These resilient blood hunters stay occupied with folktale and myth, applying their obscure knowledge to written records of history and religious sects, for fear that without a breakthrough soon, they may become the very monsters they seek.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Boon
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a monstrous boon from a cryptid from the list below. Optionally, you may also gain minor physical attributes that are reminiscent of the cryptid. For example, if you have a Tempest Monstrous Boon, you might grow feathers in your hair and have pale white eyes, or if your boon is of Leviathan, your skin may be slimy to the touch.

items.name: Frost Worm
entries: A chill comes over you, the monster from your nightmares being aware of your presence. You gain {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} to cold damage.

items.name: Leviathan
entries: You receive a blessing from the deep. You gain {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} to acid and poison damage.

items.name: Tempest
entries: The spirit of storms acts as your guide. You gain {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} to lightning damage.

items.name: Yeenoghu
entries: Part of Yeenoghu's demonic essence tethers itself to your very soul. You gain {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} to fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Mythical Hunter
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn to master tracking all kinds of creatures. Any {@skill Survival} checks you make to track a creature are made with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Uncanny Movement
entries: At 7th level, you gain a magical benefit based on a cryptid of your choice. You can choose the same cryptid you selected at 3rd level, or a different one.

items.name: Frost Worm
entries: As you look to the mountains and wonder what lies within, you feel your physiology warp. You gain a burrow speed of 30ft, and 10ft of {@sense blindsight|xphb}.

items.name: Leviathan
entries: The depths beckon you forth, something urging you to join it down there. You gain a swim speed of 30ft. In addition, any melee attacks you make underwater are no longer made at disadvantage.

items.name: Tempest
entries: A singular white feathered wing sprouts from your back, imparting you with the gifts of the sky. You gain a fly speed of 30ft and {@variantrule immunity|XPHB} to damage from non-magical weather effects.

items.name: Yeenoghu
entries: The blinding speed of Yeenoghu is imparted unto you. You can now dash as a bonus action. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against becoming {@condition poisoned|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Cryptid Physiology
entries: At 11th level, you gain a magical benefit based on a cryptid of your choice. You can choose the same cryptid you selected previously, or a different one.

items.name: Frost Worm
entries: The harsh conditions of the tundra have given you supernatural physical prowess. You gain advantage on {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Acrobatics} checks.

items.name: Leviathan
entries: The darkness of the murky depths clings to your being, allowing you to almost fade out of existence to the untrained eye. You gain advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks.

items.name: Tempest
entries: The sky welcomes you as its own, granting gifts to entice you to stay for eternity. You gain 60ft of {@sense darkvision} and can see in magical darkness. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition stunned|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Yeenoghu
entries: The abyssal fracture in your mind whispers its secrets to you, imparting gifts of knowledge. You gain the ability to speak, read and understand all languages. Additionally, you gain 90ft of {@variantrule telepathy|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of the Fates
entries: Starting at 15th level, your desire to sunder monsters from the world has empowered you. You may attack an enemy afflicted with your {@classFeature Brand of Castigation|Blood Hunter|BH2022|6} an additional time when you take the attack action.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Transmuter
entries: At 18th level, you hone your hemocraft to keep yourself alive at all costs. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of the Transmuter|Andreya} for your {@classFeature Blood Maledict|Blood Hunter|BH2022|1} feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Planeswalker
entries: The Order of the Planeswalker is the most scattered of the blood hunter orders, its founders having honed their hemocraft abilities to traverse the bounds of the planes. In particular, Planeswalkers seek to master the manipulation of the Weave from both the plane of ultimate emotion, the Feywilds and the plane of suppression of self, the Shadowfell, imparting boons and banes to survive the harsh lifestyle that comes with this order's creed.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Step
entries: When you join this order at 3rd level, you gain the ability to create tiny rifts between the planes, allowing you to displace yourself in a localised area. As an action, you create a number of spheres of magical darkness equal to your hemocraft modifier that each take up a 5ft spherical space that you can see within a 30ft radius. As a bonus action, you can teleport into any of these spheres of darkness.
This feature is usable once per short or long rest, unless you expend a use of your blood maledict feature to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Emotional Specialist
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain advantage on {@skill Insight} checks.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Healing
entries: Your connection to the vibrant life of the Feywilds and the ever-present death of the Shadowfell grant you the powers to heal one in great need. You target one creature within 30ft and roll your hemocraft die a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and add your hemocraft modifier. The creature regains hit points equal to the total. This requires no action.
This feature is usable once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of Protection
entries: Starting at 11th level, your {@classFeature Brand of Castigation|Blood Hunter|BH2022|6} aids to your defensive capabilities, dissuading enemies from attacking you. A branded enemy that attacks you suffers a hemocraft die of psychic damage and a hemocraft die of necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Mirage Recall
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you or an ally within 30ft is suffering psychic or necrotic damage, you may use your reaction to halve the damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lesser Plane Shift
entries: Starting at 15th level, you may use an action to cast {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB} with no material components. The destination plane must be either the Material Plane, the Feywilds, or the Shadowfell.
Once this feature is used, you cannot use it again for 7 days.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of Terrorising
entries: At 18th level, you hone your hemocraft to conjure illusions of your enemies greatest fears. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of Terrorising|Andreya} for your {@classFeature Blood Maledict|Blood Hunter|BH2022|1} feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Skirmisher
entries: A mysterious and merciless warrior of the Primordial Church, the Lightning Skirmisher has mastered the art of channeling chaos to wreath their being with powerful lightning. Using this effectively is the nature of battle for these skirmishers, as they charge into combat with drastic speed, neutralizing incoming damage and wielding it with reckless abandon.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Rod
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you are adept in neutralizing elemental threats around you. As a reaction any time you suffer fire, cold, lightning, acid or thunder damage you can expend a use of this feature to reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10}.

You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your Proficiency Bonus per {@variantrule short rest|xphb}. At the 10th level in this class, it increases to 2d10, and at the 18th it increases to 3d10.

subclassFeature.name: Galvanic Burst
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have a number of inert galvanic charges equal to your Proficiency Bonus. Immediately after you use your {@subclassFeature Lightning Rod|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3} feature, you activate one inert charge. When you successfully hit with a melee attack roll, you can expend an active galvanic charge to add {@damage 1d10} lightning damage to the damage roll, rendering the charge inert again. At the start of every short or long rest, you have one active charge of this ability.
At 10th level in this class, this lightning damage increases to 2d10. At 18th level, it increases to 3d10.

subclassFeature.name: Flash Point
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can channel the very speed of lightning through your being. As a bonus action, you can move an additional 10ft × your proficiency bonus. When you do this, all hostile creatures within 30ft of the point of origin must make a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 12 + your proficiency bonus, or be {@condition blinded|xphb} until the end of their next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier.
Additionally, you can now add your Constitution modifier to your Dexterity saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Static Chain
entries: Starting at 10th level, when using a {@subclassFeature Galvanic Burst|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3}, the lightning damage dealt can now jump to an additional 3 targets of your choice within 30ft. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only once per galvanic charge. You do not need to roll to hit these additional targets.

Additionally, you now have 2 active {@subclassFeature Galvanic Burst|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3||galvanic charges} after each short or long rest, the damage dealt by using a galvanic charge increases to {@damage 2d10}, and the amount of damage you can reduce from using your {@subclassFeature Lightning Rod|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3} feature increases to {@damage 2d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Overcharged
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can spend 2 active {@subclassFeature Galvanic Burst|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3||galvanic charges} to make one of your attacks into a powerful explosion of lightning energy. Each creature within a 15ft radius sphere around you must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC of 12 + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, they take {@damage 6d10} lightning damage. On a success, they take half damage.
Additionally, you now have 3 active galvanic charges after each short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Grounded Conduit
entries: Starting at 18th level, your elemental prowess has allowed you to stave off damage to a more significant degree. You gain immunity to lightning damage, and once per short or long rest you can take no damage when using your {@subclassFeature Lightning Rod|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3} feature.

Additionally, the damage dealt by using a {@subclassFeature Galvanic Burst|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3||galvanic charges} increases to {@damage 3d10}, and the amount of damage you can reduce from using your {@subclassFeature Lightning Rod|Fighter|XPHB|Lightning Skirmisher|Andreya|3} feature increases to {@damage 3d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Timekeeper
entries: A Timekeeper specializes in using magic to manipulate time and infuse their own creations with such magic, rewinding time briefly when needed to fix small mistakes. The power to make an inevitability take a fraction of time longer, or to change the outcome of things, is extremely sought after by those wishing to change the world. The essence of Mechanus emboldens your ability to manipulate the Weave, and create new possibilities that without you simply would not exist.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item weaver's tools|xphb}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|xphb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Timekeeper Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Timekeeper Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Time March
entries: You gain {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on all initiative rolls. In addition, when targeting a creature with a melee attack, spell attack, or single target spell effect, you may use a free action to mark them. Choose an ability (e.g. Wisdom). A marked creature must subtract your proficiency bonus from saving throws it makes using that ability until the start of your next turn. This feature is usable a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Foresight
entries: Immediately after the effects of your action have been determined, you can use a reaction to undo that action, restarting your turn phase. This is usable a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest. In addition, moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement.

subclassFeature.name: Accelerated Demise
entries: At 9th level, a creature marked with your {@subclassFeature Time March|Artificer|TCE|Timekeeper|Andreya|3} ability now has {@variantrule disadvantage|xphb} on saving throws caused by your spells. You may also now expend a use of your {@subclassFeature Time March|Artificer|TCE|Timekeeper|Andreya|3} ability to change the damage type of one of your spells to necrotic.
Additionally, you gain resistance to necrotic damage, and you recover all uses of your Time March feature on a {@variantrule short rest|xphb}.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Mechanus
entries: You can cast {@spell Time Stop|XPHB}. You ignore this spell's restrictions, however no damage can be dealt while under the effects of this spell.
This can be used once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Transmuter
entries: As a reaction, you transmute the damage of a spell that targets you to a damage type you resist from your {@classFeature Monstrous Boon|Blood Hunter|BH2022|Cryptid|Andreya|3} feature.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You can transmute any spell cast within 60ft of you to a damage type you have resistance to. This does not have to be from your Monstrous Boon feature.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Terrorising
entries: As a bonus action, each enemy you target within 30ft of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your hemocraft save DC. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened|XPHB} and suffers 4d10 psychic damage.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You may choose one creature to make the saving throw with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Water Minor
entries: When you cast a concentration spell, you can use your reaction to invoke the force of the tides support those around you. All members of your party gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls, armor class, and an increase to their movement speed equal to 10ft. These buffs last 3 rounds. At 5th level, this increases to +2 & 20ft, and at 13th +3 & 30ft. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

optionalfeature.name: Chaos Minor
entries: When you cast a spell that reduces a creature to zero hit points, you absorb some of their magical essence, strengthening you. You can immediately use {@classFeature arcane recovery|Wizard||1}. This does not count towards normal uses of arcane recovery. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest}.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Minor
entries: When you cast a healing or buffing spell on a creature you may invoke the fires of passionate love to burn away any semblance of negativity. When invoked you can use a reaction to end a spell effect of 3rd level or lower, or the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition frightened} or {@condition stunned} conditions. This applies to one creature, including yourself. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest}.

optionalfeature.name: Hill Minor
entries: When eating food or drinking alcohol, you may invoke the power of gluttony. All hit dice rolled for a {@variantrule short rest} are doubled, and you regain a spell slot equal to half your PB or lower, rounding down. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest}.

optionalfeature.name: Water Major: Istishia's Impetous

prerequisite.other: Must use the {@optfeature Water Minor|Andreya} burst 5 times, and visit a place of significance.

entries: The sea churns with an unmistakable strength. When you cast a concentration spell or activate a limited use ability you can use your reaction to invoke the force of the tides support those around you. The members of your party gain +1 to attack rolls, armour class and a 10ft increase to their movement speed. These buffs last 5 rounds. At 5th level, this increases to +2 & 20ft, and at 13th +3 & 30ft. Each person in your party is under the effect of {@spell Freedom of Movement|XPHB} and the party shares a communal use of {@spell Death Ward|XPHB}. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest|xphb}.

optionalfeature.name: Cloud Minor
entries: When you cast a spell that debuffs or damages a creature, you can double the range of the spell. When doing this, the creature must make a DC15 Strength saving throw, or fall {@conditoon prone} and take PB × {@damage d6} thunder damage. They take half as much on a success. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest}.

optionalfeature.name: Blaze Minor
entries: The strength of the forge emboldens you. When crafting, you can expend this rune to give a number of creatures equal to your PB {@variantrule advantage} on any rolls made with {@filter tools|items|source=xphb|type=tool;artisan's tools} until the next short or long rest. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest}.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Minor
entries: When making an attack roll, you can use a reaction to invoke the quiet chill of unknown entities. The target must make a DC15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is frozen, suffering the {@condition paralyzed} condition. They may remake the save at the end of their turns. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest}.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Minor
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon or spell attack, you may use a reaction to invoke the rune of earth, conjuring a series of earthen hands to grasp the target. The attack deals an additional die of damage. In addition, the target must make a DC15 Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained}, and must take an action to break free. This burst is usable once per {@variantrule long rest}.

Humans are the cockroaches of the multiverse because they are so tenacious, and because they have a knack for breeding with anything. One of your ancestors was such a bold soul as to spend some long nights with dragonborn, kobold or lizardfolk people such that either you or your parents were created. Born with some latent reptilian features, you are mostly human in appearance. Some Jragonfolk possess scales that rim their face like a mask, others are born shorter than the rest, and some have hard, dry skin on their arms and torso, making them more resilient to the dangers of this world. Harnessing this power comes naturally, Jragonfolk often possessing the ability to project their voice and command attention, sometimes even at the detriment of their foes.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young Jragonfolk grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

entries.name: Size
entries: Jragonfolk are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have Jragonic ancestry. Choose one feature from the list of Jragonian traits below:

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Your lineage stems from a dragon progenitor. Choose the kind of dragon from the Draconic Ancestors table. Your choice affects they type of damage your breath weapon deals, as well as your appearance.

When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} damage of the type associated with your Dragonic Ancestor. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

items.name: Draconic Cry
entries: As a {@variantrule bonus action|xphb}, you let out a cry at your enemies within 10 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you and your allies have {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on attack rolls against any of those enemies who could hear you. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Natural Armour
entries: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your base AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

Chaos genasi descend from genies from the the elemental planes, their ancestry being a mix of at least two of Dao, Djinni, Efreeti, or Marid. When the latent genes of your bloodline became active, you became much more connected to the elemental chaos than one of the four planes themselves. Chaos genasi are often subject to random events of magic, and are unable to fully control their abilities.

Their skin is changes between shades of red, blue, green, and grey, sometimes a blend of them or a much more patchwork arrangement. If they have a human skin tone, there is a great spots on their body that looks like they're glistening with moisture, incredibly calloused, burned or windswept. Their hair usually changes by the day, from human like to flame to seaweed.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an Elemental.

entries.name: Chaotic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule resistance|xphb} to a random damage type. After each {@variantrule long rest|xphb}, roll on the resistance table below:

entries.name: One with Chaos
entries: You know the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Chaos Bolt|XGE} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Nathair's Mischief|FTD} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast these spells with this trait, you can't cast them again this way until you finish a {@variantrule long rest|xphb}. You can also cast these spells with a spell slot of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this lineage).

feat.name: Subterranean Liberator
entries: You may spend your bonus action to focus before making an attack. You may add a {@dice d4} to an attack roll you make on this turn, and roll a {@damage d4} of additional damage.
If you have a feature that grants you extra attacks, you may forfeit one of your attacks for {@variantrule advantage|xphb}. On a hit, all dice are doubled. On a critical hit, all dice are tripled.

feat.name: Beyond Endurance or Might
entries: Once per {@variantrule short rest|xphb} you can produce a feat of martial skill. When making a melee attack roll, you can strike all creatures of your choice within 5ft. All targets suffer from the effects of a skill like stunning strike, divine smite, favoured foe, a battle master manoeuvre, etc. when this ability is used. Spells that have you make a melee attack (such as {@spell booming blade|tce}) do not trigger on all creatures.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

item.name: +1 Blightwood Wand
entries: While holding this wand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your thaumaturge spells.

You may pick a leveled spell at the end of a {@variantrule long rest|xphb} on a spell list besides your own. You can add this to your spells prepared for the day. The level of the spell must not be higher your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Totem of the Elements
entries: The Totem of the Elements is a magical woven tapestry created by The Coven of the Star Spirits, who can be found in different sects on every continent.

The totem has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. Whenever you expend a use of your {@classFeature Dire Sacrifice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|1} feature, you may expend a charge to change the damage type of the spell to cold, fire, lightning or thunder.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB}, {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|FTD}, and {@spell Fly|XPHB} once each per long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these is Intelligence.

item.name: Totem of Souls
entries: The Totem of Souls is a magical woodcarving created by The Coven of Wilting, which was said to merge with the Cloven Order to form the Cerberus Network found throughout Andreya today.

The totem has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.
