Whenever you expend a use of your {@classFeature Dire Sacrifice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|1} feature, you may expend a charge to force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened|xphb} for the next minute. The creature may reattempt the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Wither and Bloom|SCC}, and {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} once each per long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these is Intelligence.

item.name: Totem of Dreams
entries: The Totem of Dreams is a magical painting created by The Coven of Stories, hailing from the continent of Viridis before it was consigned to the waves.

The totem has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. Whenever you expend a use of your {@classFeature Dire Sacrifice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|1} feature, you may expend a charge to gain insight into the creature's desires. If what they seek is a feeling or idea, it will be understood, but without context.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, {@spell Mirror Image|XPHB}, and {@spell Major Image|XPHB} once each per long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these is Intelligence.

item.name: Totem of the Alchemist
entries: The Totem of the Alchemist is a magical glass piece created by The Coven of Lunafaction, a group hailing from Palaru, Ifreya.

The totem has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. Whenever you expend a use of your {@classFeature Dire Sacrifice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|1} feature, you may expend a charge to destroy a non-magical item, weapon or armor held or worn by the creature.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell Magnify Gravity|EGW}, {@spell Alter Self|XPHB}, and {@spell Blink|XPHB} once each per long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these is Intelligence.

item.name: Totem of the Oracle
entries: The Totem of the Oracle is a magical ceramic created by The Coven of the White Rose, said to be founded by the remnants of an ancient civilisation.

The totem has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. Whenever you expend a use of your {@classFeature Dire Sacrifice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|1} feature, you may expend a charge to subtract a {@dice d6} from the next saving throw the creature makes.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB}, and {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} once each per long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these is Intelligence.

item.name: Totem of the Planes
entries: The Totem of the Planes is a tiny magical machine created by The Coven of the Prismatic Peony, who came together under the guidance of the Arcanist Cyran Ulawarin and the Runic Scholar Hans.

The totem has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. Whenever you expend a use of your {@classFeature Dire Sacrifice|Thaumaturge|Andreya|1} feature, you may expend a charge to increase your armor class by 2 until the start of your next turn.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell Arms of Hadar|XPHB}, {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, and {@spell Hunger of Hadar|XPHB} once each per long rest. Your spellcasting ability for these is Intelligence.

entries.replace: acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder

spell.name: Ashryn's Gibbous Gleam
entries: Brilliant moonlight flashes in a 30ft radius sphere centred on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that light must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition blinded|XPHB} and it has {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws. On a successful save, it isn't blinded by this spell. Undead and oozes have {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on this saving throw. In addition, and creature touched by the moonlight loses {@variantrule resistance|xphb} to radiant and necrotic damage for 1 minute, if they have it already.
A creature {@condition blinded|XPHB} by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition blinded|XPHB}.

spell.name: Become Plant

components.m: A leaf and a handful of dirt

entries: You turn a willing creature into a Medium or Small non-magical plant of your choice. While in this form, the creature is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, cannot speak, cannot understand non-telepathic forms of communication, and can communicate with other plants telepathically. The creature's Intelligence and Wisdom modifiers do not change while it is in this form.
The creature loses all other senses and gains 30ft of {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}. If the plant is destroyed, the creature reverts back to its original form.

spell.name: Feign Magic
entries: You touch an object, magical or non-magical, and attempt to disguise its true nature, making it appear differently to magical effects that attempt to show it.
If an object is magical, you can change the school of magic it appears as when viewed with {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} or a similar effect.
If an object is non-magical, you can make it appear to be magical when viewed with {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} or a similar effect. You choose the school of magic it appears as.
A creature with reasonable suspicion may make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) check against your spellcasting DC to determine that the object has been tampered with.

spell.name: Gift of Dawn

components.m: A small piece of green fluorite

entries: A willing creature you touch is given the opportunity to grow from a nurturing environment and a sense of comradery. The target gains {@damage 4d8} {@variantrule temporary hit points|XPHB}, and while those temporary hit points remain, the creature is resistant to all damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the {@variantrule temporary hit points|XPHB} gained increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|3-9|1d8}.

spell.name: Goldcrown's Arcane Maelstrom
entries: Raw magical energy gives way to your will as you gain the ability to twist spells around you in a way that you desire. Whenever a spell of 8th level or lower is cast within 60 ft of you, you may use a reaction to do one of the following:

items.entry: Give a creature that you can see {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} or {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on a saving throw caused by the spell
Change the damage type of the spell
Give the spell attack roll {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} or {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB}

entries: Additionally, if the spell is 5th level or lower, you may additionally choose a second effect from the list below:

items.entry: Double the damage dice of the spell
Halve the damage dice of the spell (rounded up)

spell.name: Vicious Vines
entries: Thorny vines sprout from the ground around a creature of size Huge or smaller within range. The creature targeted by the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or suffer {@damage 3d8} piercing damage and be {@condition restrained|XPHB} by the entangling vines until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the vines can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself, and the spell ends early. On a failure, the target takes an additional {@damage 3d8} piercing damage.
When the spell ends, the conjured vines wilt away.

spell.name: Hollyhawk's Miracle Moonbow
entries: You create a shining bow of pure moonlight, harnessing the energy of The Moonweaver herself. Until the spell ends, you may use your action to fire two arrows on each of your turns. Make two ranged spell attacks. The first deals {@damage 6d12} magical piercing damage and the second deals {@damage 6d12} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, The damage increases by {@scaledamage 6d12|7-9|1d12} per arrow.

spell.name: Horecen's Poison Needle
entries: A large needle of poison shoots towards a creature of your choice within range. The creature takes {@damage 3d8} poison damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell at 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Irvine's Find Familiar
entries: You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: {@creature Bat|XPHB}, {@creature Cat|XPHB}, {@creature Crab|XMM}, {@creature Fox|IDRotF}, {@creature Frog|XPHB}, {@creature Hawk|XPHB}, {@creature Lizard|XPHB}, {@creature Octopus|XPHB}, {@creature Owl|XPHB}, {@creature Pseudodragon|XMM}, {@creature Poisonous Snake|MM}, Fish ({@creature Quipper|MM}), {@creature Rat|XPHB}, {@creature Raven|XPHB}, {@creature Seahorse|XMM}, {@creature Spider|XPHB}, or {@creature Weasel|XPHB}. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a beast.

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal. In addition, your familiar is able to speak and be understood by all creatures that can speak at least one language, as if the spell tongues was cast on them.

When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As an action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 hit points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms from the above list. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

spell.name: Jhaeros' Twisted Reckoning

time.condition: which you take when you take damage from a spell.

entries: As you suffer damage from a spell, you can use your reaction to absorb part of the spell's essence from the Weave. The essence empowers your next melee attack that hits a target, half the damage you recieved being added to the weapon damage on that strike.

spell.name: Kite's Calamitous Cannons

components.m: An eyepatch or a maritime hat

entries: You summon a spectral pirate ship with an ethereal glow. The ship floats above you for the duration of the spell and moves with you.
As a bonus action, you can command it to fire. Make a ranged spell attack targeting a creature within range. On a hit, the target suffers {@damage 4d8} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature when commanding the ship to fire per two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Light of Change
entries: A 90-foot-radius sphere of light spreads out from a point you choose within range. The sphere is bright light and sheds dim light for an additional 60 feet.

Up to 12 creatures within this area of your choice gain 40 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws, and gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to a damage type of your choosing. This damage type cannot be bludgeoning, piercing or slashing.

spell.name: Lucretia's Fractured Jaunt
entries: You magically twist space around one or two creatures you can see within range. With this spell you may either teleport a creature you can see within range to an unoccupied space within 60ft of themselves, {@i or} swap two creatures you can see within 120ft of you and no more than 60ft from each other. An unwilling creature must make a CON save. If you're swapping two creatures, at least one must be willingm and the new location must be on a solid surface for at least one of the creatures.

spell.name: Messer's Watery Doom
entries: As an action, you create a liquid skin around a hostile creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the liquid contracts and begins to freeze. The target suffers {@damage 2d6} cold damage and their {@variantrule speed|XPHB} is halved. The target has {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and dexterity saving throws. If the target is in water, their {@variantrule speed|XPHB} becomes zero. At the end of each of the targets' turns, they may attempt to remake the save. At the start of subsequent turns the target takes an additional {@damage 2d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, you may choose an additional target per two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Natti's Hag Hut

m.text: A gemstone worth at least 50gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You conjure a small cottage on two large chicken legs in range that lasts for the duration. The hut is a Construct of size category Huge. The door on the hut is 5 feet wide and 10 feet tall, and leads to an extradimensional dwelling. You and any creatures you designate when you cast the spell can enter the extradimensional dwelling as long as the door remains open. You can open or close it (no action required) if you are within 30 feet of it.
Beyond the door is a magnificent foyer with numerous chambers beyond. The dwelling's atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.

You can create any floor plan you like for the dwelling, but it can't exceed 50 contiguous 10-foot Cubes. The place is furnished and decorated as you choose. It contains sufficient food to serve a nine-course banquet for up to 100 people. Furnishings and other objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if removed from it.

A staff of 100 near-transparent servants attends all who enter. You determine the appearance of these servants and their attire. They are invulnerable and obey your commands. Each servant can perform tasks that a human could perform, but they can't attack or take any action that would directly harm another creature. Thus the servants can fetch things, clean, mend, fold clothes, light fires, serve food, pour wine, and so on. The servants can't leave the dwelling.

While inside, the hut will travel in a direction you ordain when you cast the spell. The hut can travel a total of 30 miles while you are inside it. In one room of the casters choice there is a window in which the outside world can be seen. The hut has an AC of 17 and 100 {@variantrule hit points|XPHB}. The hut is resistant to all damage except thunder damage and damage from weapons with the siege tag.
When the spell ends, any creatures or objects left inside the extradimensional space are expelled into the unoccupied spaces nearest to the entrance.

spell.name: Natural Fatigue

time.condition: which you take when a creature uses an innate magical ability.

entries: You target a creature using an innate magical ability, such as a Dragon's Breath Weapon or Mindflayer's Mind Blast and use your reaction to force that creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the effect is stifled and behaves as if it were used, and the creature is unable to use complete the attack.

spell.name: Natural Redirection

time.condition: which you take when a creature uses an innate magical ability.

entries: You target a creature using an innate magical ability, such as a Dragon's Breath Weapon or Mindflayer's Mind Blast and use your reaction to force that creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you can change the direction that the ability is being used in, allowing you to force that creature to hit its allies or nothing at all, providing safety to you and your allies.

spell.name: Pinch of Galep Dah
entries: You create a blockage in a creature's connection to its source of magic. Until the end of the spell, the creature is prevented from casting one spell you know it is able to cast.

spell.name: Psionic Hold
entries: Kinetic energy vibrates around your hand to deliver a painful mental barrage to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll if the target is unaware of your location. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage, and it can't take bonus actions until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Quincy's Plague Flood
entries: Target one creature within range. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, that creature loses 4 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and is considered {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}. These 4 hit dice can be divided amongst any creatures of your choosing within a 20ft radius sphere of the target, including yourself. These are rolled immediately, healing the creatures an amount equal to the roll plus the target's Constitution modifier.

spell.name: Reject Reality
entries: You attempt to reshape another creature's memories. One creature that you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw. If you are fighting the creature, it has {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on the saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you for the duration. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} target is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} and unaware of its surroundings, though it can still hear you. If the target takes any damage or is targeted by another spell, this spell ends. If the spell ends before the full minute of the spell's duration has passed, none of the target's memories are modified.

While this charm lasts, you can affect the target's memory of an event that it experienced within the last 5 years and that lasted no more than 1 hour. You can completely invent new memories that seem entirely real to the target, and cause conflicting memories to be supressed. This may change the way a target will act once the charm ends.

You must speak to the target to describe how its memories are affected, and it must be able to understand your language for the modified memories to take root. This spell can affect the target's inclinations, alignment and beliefs.
A {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} or {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} spell cast on the target restores the creature's true memory.

spell.name: Repelling Strike
entries: You conjure a large hand of arcane force that strikes towards your opponents. Make a ranged spell attack roll targeting one creature you can see in range. If the attack hits, the target suffers {@damage 1d6} force damage and if the target is Huge or smaller, the creature is pushed backwards 10ft in a straight line.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Rinedellion's Reconstruction

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range casting a spell that deals acid, fire, cold, lightning, thunder, necrotic, radiant, or poison damage.

entries: You twist the inherent magic within a spell to something new entirely. Replace the damage type of a spell with another damage type you choose. The new damage type must be acid, fire, cold, necrotic, lightning, thunder, radiant, or poison.
The damage type of the spell is replaced with the one you choose for the full duration of the affected spell.

spell.name: Sinclair's Draining Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon pierces both body and mind, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage to the target. The caster regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage rolled.

spell.name: Steadfast

m.text: A picture of the person closest to you, and a model boat worth 10gp

entries: Your spirit becomes guarded by the faith placed in your allies, friends and lovers. You gain {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom saving throws, and have {@variantrule resistance|xphb} to psychic damage. When you see a creature friendly to you within 60ft take damage, you may use your reaction to take half, or all of that damage yourself. The other creature suffers all other effects that may result from whatever caused the damage. Whenever you are within 5ft of an ally, you have {@variantrule advantage|xphb} on {@status concentration|XPHB} saving throws.

spell.name: Stormwind's Soundwave
entries: You create an intense cacophony of sound as a spectral instrument plays a magical note at a disturbing volume, in a 20ft cube centred on a point within range. All creatures within the area must succeed a Constitution saving throw or suffer {@damage 6d12} thunder damage + 40 lightning damage. On a success, they suffer no damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the thunder damage increases by {@scaledamage 6d12|6-9|2d12} per level.

spell.name: Terrifying Brew

entries: Who let you cook?

Make a ranged attack roll on a creature in range. On a critical miss, the spell instead targets you. On a hit, the spell deals {@damage 3d8} acid damage, and the targeted creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, roll a d8 to determine a secondary effect from the table below. The target experiences the effect until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Transmute Alcohol
entries: You transform 5 ounces of clean water into an alcoholic substance of your choice.

spell.name: Valentine's Inginuity

components.m: A page from a book at least a century old

entries: A 20ft-radius sphere centred on a point within range is surrounded by books that whisper an incomprehensible amount of knowledge all at once. Each creature within the sphere must make an Intelligence saving throw. Creatures suffer {@damage 3d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Additionally, a creature who fails the saving throw becomes {@condition Stunned|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Whimsy
entries: You tap into the madness of the Feywilds and create an illusory manifestation of its chaos, visible only to the target. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition incapacitated|xphb} for the duration. At the end of each of the target's turns, before the spell ends, the target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take 4d8 damage of the type matching the chosen court from the table below. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or higher, you may choose an additional target per two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Wreath's Sonorous Cyclone
entries: A destructive cyclone encompassing a 10ft diameter cylinder appears in a space within range.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn, or starts its turn there, it is engulfed in crackling winds that cause shocking pain, and must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 5d12} force damage and {@damage 5d12} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use a bonus action to move the cyclone up to 60 feet in any direction.

spell.name: Ziggurat of Wounds
entries: A tiny ziggurat appears within 30ft of you in an unoccupied 5ft cube space. The ziggurat has an {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} of 20 and {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 10 + the casters level. It takes its turn immediately after you and can pick up to 3 creatures of your choice. Each creature must make a Intelligence saving throw against your spellcasting DC or take {@damage 4d6} psychic damage. On a successful save, they take no damage.
